page.title: 20Children's Ideas, N. Lopham
page.content: St. Andrew's School leavers for July 1985, aged 11, have recorded some of their feelings, so that children in the future can compare their own. Things they enjoy include: playing the recorder or piano, drawing, sports, reading, computer work, bicycling, spider collecting, swimming, eating, animals, playing around, laughing. They dislike: eating peanut butter or liver, trying on clothes, buying shoes, moaning people, brothers, school, some teachers and mums, hot stuffy places, part-cooked food, acting. Their fears include: snakes, the dark, heights, hospitals, nuclear war, Doomsday, drowning, burning, big spiders. Among their hopes for the future are: a job, being a lawyer, soldier, teacher, famous pop star, mechanic, being wealthy, having a cat, farm, racer.
